intro: Melicope vieillardii, commonly known as the New Caledonia melicope, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant has smooth, grayish bark and produces yellowish-green fruits that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
